import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
%matplotlib inline
import numpy as  np
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')
source.65caa51c:
print(data.status.unique())
print(data.status.value_counts())
(data.status.value_counts()/306)      #realtive frequency of survival of more than 5 years after operation
source.584f3263:
#plotting pddf and cdf of age,nodes and  year attribute


plt.figure(figsize=(20,5))
for indx, col in enumerate(list(data.columns)[:-1]):
    plt.subplot(1, 3, indx+1)
    print("********* "+col+" *********")
    counts, bin_edge = np.histogram(data[col], bins=10, density=True)
    print("Bin Edges: {}".format(bin_edge))
    pdf = counts/sum(counts)
    print("PDF: {}".format(pdf))
    cdf = np.cumsum(pdf)
    print("CDF: {}".format(cdf))
    plt.plot(bin_edge[1:], pdf, bin_edge[1:], cdf,label=col)
    plt.xlabel(col,fontsize='x-large')
    plt.ylabel('probability density',fontsize='x-large')
    plt.title("PDF and CDF of "+col,fontsize='x-large')
    plt.tick_params(labelsize=15)
source.0bf5fbdc:
#box  plot
fig,axes=plt.subplots(1,3,figsize=(20,8))
for idx,col in enumerate(list(data.columns)[:-1]):     #leave status  column  
    b=sns.boxplot(x='status',hue='status',y=col,data=data,ax=axes[idx])
    b.axes.set_title("boxplot bw status and  "+col,fontsize=20)
    b.set_xlabel('status',fontsize=20)
    b.set_ylabel(col,fontsize=20)
    b.tick_params(labelsize=15)
#sns.plt.show()
plt.show()
source.aa8b42c6:
fig,axes=plt.subplots(1,3,figsize=(18,7))
for idx,col in enumerate(list(data.columns)[:-1]):
        b=sns.violinplot(data=data,x='status',hue='status',y=col,ax=axes[idx])
        b.axes.set_title("violin plot bw status and  "+col,fontsize=20)
        b.set_xlabel('status',fontsize=20)
        b.set_ylabel(col,fontsize=20)
        b.tick_params(labelsize=10)

source.f36911d2:
# Data description
The Haberman’s survival data set contains cases from a study that was conducted between 1958 and 1970 at the University of Chicago’s Billings Hospital on the survival of patients who had undergone surgery for breast cancer.
source.fc416cb7:
# Observation Patients age vary from 30 to 83 with the mean of 52.
Maximum number of posititive nodes observed is 52, but nearly 75% of the patients have less than 5 positive nodes and nearly 25% of the patients have no positive nodes.

source.4c47980d:
# Obeservations from violin plot of status and nodes we can conclude that-

1.The number of positive nodes of the survivors is highly dense from 0 to 5
2.About 76% people have positive nodes between 0-5

from violin plot of status and year we can conclude that-

3.Patient treated after 1966 have more chances to survive.
4.Patient treated before 1961 have less chance to survive

from violin plot of status and age we can conclude that-

5.Patient that have age below 40 are less likely to die.
source.af01b207:
# Attribute information It contains 4 columns and 306 rows
Columns description are as follows
age: Age of patient at the time of operation
year: Year of operation
nodes: Number of positive nodes detected
status: Whether patient survived more than 5 years or not.
